TopicTitle: [WIP] Orion and Space Launch System (SLS) Development Thread

Articles.Content:
So this started as a personal project but I thought I'd share with everyone on here since there doesn't seem to be a replica SLS mod yet. I know there are already a few in development, but most of them seem to either be dead, moving very slowly, or are different to what I'm making, plus it's a personal project as I said so I'm going to make it anyway

This is my first time attempting to make a mod for Kerbal Space Program, and while I shouldn't have any issues with modelling and texturing I haven't any experience with creating specifically for KSP so it should be interesting learning how it works.

On to what the mod actually is. I'm making an accurately scaled replica of the SLS as well as the Orion MPCV. It's the spacecraft I've always wanted on KSP and since no one has made it yet I thought I might as well do it. The plan is to create a scale version for stock KSP as well as a full size version for Real Solar System.

Here are some renders of what I currently have. Apart from a few details I think the modelling is pretty much complete, so I will be moving on to textures shortly.

Javascript is disabled. View full album

Cool! Looks low-detail so far but cool!

Quality work. Very well done! However there is one sls mods in development.http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/85275-WIP-NASA-SLS-Preview-Release-1-%288-5-2014%29?highlight=sls+development . At the moment that mod seems to be mostly sls payloads with the lanchers made by YANFRET.

[Edit]

Very sorry, I didnt see that you mentioned that.

As you said there are a lot of SLS projects out there, but it seems they were (most of them) cursed and never got a proper release, so I'm looking forward to this as the models seem very nice already.

Cool! Looks low-detail so far but cool!

Yeah I need to add the details and pipes on the boosters and tanks, but most of the small stuff will be covered by the normal maps.
Well I will add this to the collection of SLS thread I follow. Lets see how far this one goes. Looks great so far please don't be cursed like the rest.

As you said there are a lot of SLS projects out there, but it seems they were (most of them) cursed and never got a proper release, so I'm looking forward to this as the models seem very nice already.

There are quite a few now, but I haven't seen much progress on many of them. As you say, it seems like they're cursed.

Thanks! I hope to finish this one and not have it added to the pile of incomplete SLS replicas.

There are quite a few now, but I haven't seen much progress on many of them. As you say, it seems like they're cursed.

Thanks! I hope to finish this one and not have it added to the pile of incomplete SLS replicas.

I believe there are 3 dead SLS projects out there. The models you made are very good! I hope you won't run into problems with this mod.

I would like to extend my full support and preemptive praise right now, and I hope you make it through this project alive. If you do, you will be my new best friend.

Good luck!!

Update 22/09/14

Finished the modelling and now working on the UV mapping. It's coming along quite well, although work will probably be quite slow for the next week or so. UV mapping of the Orion Capsule is done, a few smoothing issues (such as the engines on the first stage which can be seen in the original images) have been fixed, and currently I'm on the tedious job of UV'ing the Service Module. Here's a few images of the progress:

One small wish: make boosters cones separate objects, I want to be able to replicate Ares-1

I cant wait for this to be released. I have been looking for something like this for a while.

@sashan

Hi, thanks a lot!

I'm using 3ds Max for this project, and don't worry, they're already separate objects for exactly the reason you stated

Is the escape system properly divided into parts? There should be a control motor (RCS), a separation motor and an abort motor. Very few KSP escape towers get that one right.

Another thing you should take a look at is the movable nozzle for the ICPS. The nozzle on the real RL-10B-2 is extendable to save space in the interstage. Also, the ICPS should likely have some sort of RCS for roll control, ullage and steering in coast phase. Since you're making an RSS version, this is an important consideration, since you don't have SAS for that.
